item.name: Mark
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to making a mark on something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to making a mark on something?
questionGroup.words: mark, stain

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a mark on something?
questionGroup.words: mark, stain, spot, smudge, fingerprint

item.name: Divide into pieces
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to dividing something into parts or pieces, perhaps with the added idea of using care, or into a certain number of parts.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words are used of dividing something into parts?
questionGroup.words: divide (up), divide into pieces, division, split (up), halve, quarter (v), apportion, take apart

item.name: Break
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring breaking something into pieces, perhaps with the added idea of doing it accidentally or without being careful.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to something breaking?
questionGroup.words: break

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to breaking something?
questionGroup.words: break, bust, fracture

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to breaking something into many small pieces?
questionGroup.words: break into pieces, smash, crush, pulverize, atomize

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe something that has been broken?
questionGroup.words: broken, smashed, crushed, pulverized, (be) in pieces, busted

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to breaking through a barrier?
questionGroup.words: break through, breakout

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to a container like a bag, bottle, or bubble breaking because there was too much inside?
questionGroup.words: burst, break open

questionGroup.question: (7) What sounds do things make when they break?
questionGroup.words: snap, crack, pop, boom, crash

questionGroup.question: (8) What words describe something that is easily broken?
questionGroup.words: breakable, brittle, delicate, fragile, flimsy

questionGroup.question: (9) What words describe something that is not easily broken?
questionGroup.words: strong, tough, hard, unbreakable, durable

item.name: Crack
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to a crack--a partial break in something that does not entirely divide it in pieces.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a crack?
questionGroup.words: crack, split, fissure, crevasse

item.name: Cut
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to cutting something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What general words refer to cutting something?
questionGroup.words: cut

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to cutting something with one slice?
questionGroup.words: slice, cut once, cut in one movement

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to cutting something with many slices?
questionGroup.words: hack, cut repeatedly

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to cutting something into many pieces?
questionGroup.words: cut up, cut into pieces, dice, grate, shred, cube, quarter, halve, mince, grind

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to cutting something with a swinging motion?
questionGroup.words: chop

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to cutting something with a particular tool?
questionGroup.words: knife, ax

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to a cut?
questionGroup.words: cut, incision

item.name: Tear, rip
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to tearing or ripping something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to tearing something?
questionGroup.words: tear, rip, shred

item.name: Make hole, opening
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to making a hole or opening in something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to making a hole in something?
questionGroup.words: make a hole, make an opening, pierce, put a hole in, bore, drill, stab, broach

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to an opening?
questionGroup.words: opening, hole, aperture

item.name: Dig
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to digging in the ground.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to digging?
questionGroup.words: dig, mine, excavate, tunnel, burrow, unearth, undermine, cave in, bulldoze, shovel out, scoop, scratch out, scrape, drill, dredge, sink (a hole)

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a hole dug in the ground?
questionGroup.words: hole, pit, mine, excavation, tunnel, burrow, trench, ditch, shaft, foxhole, crater, cave, cavern, grotto

questionGroup.question: (3) What tools and machines are used to dig?
questionGroup.words: shovel, spade, hoe, pickaxe, steam shovel, bulldozer, backhoe

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe the size of a hole in the ground?
questionGroup.words: deep, shallow, narrow, wide

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to putting something in a hole and covering it up?
questionGroup.words: bury

item.name: Break, wear out
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to something breaking or wearing out, especially for things that people make and use.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to something breaking?
questionGroup.words: break, bust, give out

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that has broken?
questionGroup.words: broken, broken down, busted

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to something wearing out?
questionGroup.words: wear, wear out, deteriorate

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe something that is worn?
questionGroup.words: used, well used, worn, well worn, is past its prime, second hand

questionGroup.question: (5) What words describe something that has been used so much that it is no longer useful?
questionGroup.words: worn out, has had it, is past it

item.name: Damage
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to damaging something--to do something bad to something, but not completely ruin it so that it can't be used any more.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to damaging something?
questionGroup.words: damage, do damage, cause damage, break, bust, chip, corrode, corrupt, deface, dent, erode, harm, do harm, hurt, impair, injure, maltreat, mar, mess up, nick, sabotage, score, scratch, spoil, vandalize

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to deliberately damaging something?
questionGroup.words: vandalize, vandal, smash up, sabotage, tamper with, deface, desecrate

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to something being damaged over a long period of time?
questionGroup.words: wear away, corrode, erode

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to using something for a long time until it is damaged?
questionGroup.words: wear away, wear out

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the act of damaging something?
questionGroup.words: corrosion, detriment, erosion, maltreatment, mischief, vandalism

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the damage done to something?
questionGroup.words: damage (n), scar, wear (n), wear and tear

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to a person who damages things?
questionGroup.words: vandal, saboteur, bull in a china shop

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to something that damages things?
questionGroup.words: blight

questionGroup.question: (9) What words describe something that damages things?
questionGroup.words: harmful, toxic, toxicity, unwholesome, dangerous

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to something that has been damaged?
questionGroup.words: breakages, damaged goods

questionGroup.question: (11) What words describe something that has been damaged?
questionGroup.words: spoiled, broken, busted, messed up, damaged, crumbling, moth-eaten

questionGroup.question: (12) What words describe something that can be damaged easily?
questionGroup.words: vulnerable

item.name: Tear down
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to tearing down buildings and other structures.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to tearing something down?
questionGroup.words: tear down, demolish, dismantle, take apart, take down

item.name: Destroy
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to destroying something--to damage something so that it is beyond repair and cannot be used.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to destroying something?
questionGroup.words: destroy, blow up, hose (v), ruin, total (v), wreck, blow up, burn down

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to something being destroyed?
questionGroup.words: fall down, collapse, be blown down

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the act or process of destroying something?
questionGroup.words: destruction, ruin

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to someone or something that destroys things?
questionGroup.words: destroyer

questionGroup.question: (5) What words describe someone of something that destroys things?
questionGroup.words: destructive

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to something that has been destroyed?
questionGroup.words: ruin, wreck, wreckage, shipwreck

questionGroup.question: (7) What words describe something that has been destroyed?
questionGroup.words: destroyed, ruined, wrecked, be in ruins

item.name: Repair
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to repairing something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to repairing something?
questionGroup.words: repair, fix, mend, restore, restoration, undo, correct, rebuild, right, put to rights

item.name: States
item.descr: Use this domain for general words refer to the state or condition of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What general words refer to the state or condition of something?
questionGroup.words: state, condition, shape, position
questionGroup.sentences: What <state> is your house in?; My house is in bad <shape>.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate the state that something is in?
questionGroup.words: be, fare, stand
questionGroup.sentences: How are you <faring>?; How do things <stand> at work?

item.name: Quantity
item.descr: Use this domain for general words referring to the amount or quantity of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to the amount of something?
questionGroup.words: amount, quantity, level, volume, percentage, proportion, sum, how much, ($100) worth

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to the amount of something that can be counted?
questionGroup.words: number, how many, numbers, ratio

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the amount of food that someone is given?
questionGroup.words: portion, helping, serving, intake, ration, measure

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to a measured amount of something?
questionGroup.words: quota, load

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the amount of something, such as fuel, that is available to be used?
questionGroup.words: pool, stock, reserves

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the amount of medicine that a sick person needs?
questionGroup.words: dose, dosage

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to the amount of a problem such as crime or damage?
questionGroup.words: extent, incidence, level, rate

item.name: Number
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to numbers. Every language has a word for 'one', and a word for 'two'. These two numbers often have special words. So we have included a separate domain for 'one' and 'two'. In addition the numbers form a series (one, two, three...). Most languages have more than one series of numbers (first, second, third...). So we have also included a domain for each series of numbers that most languages have. Your language may have other series of numbers. Put them in the domain 'Number series'.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a written number?
questionGroup.words: number, figure, digit, numeral

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a number of people or things?
questionGroup.words: toll, statistics

questionGroup.question: (3) What words describe different kinds of numbers?
questionGroup.words: even, odd, positive, negative, infinite, cardinal, ordinal, whole, fraction, decimal

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to writing numbers on a series of things?
questionGroup.words: number (v), numbered

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that there are a particular number of something?
questionGroup.words: number (v)
questionGroup.sentences: The group <numbered> fifty.

item.name: Cardinal numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to the cardinal numbers (one, two, three)--the numbers used to count.

questionGroup.question: (1) What are the cardinal numbers? (the numbers you use when you count)
questionGroup.words: zero, one, two, three, four, five, six, seven, eight, nine, ten, eleven, twelve, thirteen...

questionGroup.question: (2) multiples of ten
questionGroup.words: ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, sixty, seventy, eighty, ninety

questionGroup.question: (3) multiples of one hundred
questionGroup.words: one hundred, two hundred

questionGroup.question: (4) multiples of one thousand
questionGroup.words: one thousand, two thousand

questionGroup.question: (5) numbers larger than one thousand
questionGroup.words: million, billion, trillion, quadrillion

questionGroup.question: (6) What words are used to refer to the numbers of a certain decimal place?
questionGroup.words: the digits, the tens, hundreds, thousands, millions, billions, trillions

questionGroup.question: (7) What words are used to refer to groups of a certain decimal place?
questionGroup.words: tens, hundreds, thousands, tens of thousands, millions, billions, trillions

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to a very large number?
questionGroup.words: huge number, myriad, zillion, jillion, umpteen, googolplex

questionGroup.question: (9) What words refer to an unlimited number?
questionGroup.words: infinity, infinite, boundless, endless, limitless

item.name: One
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to the number one. It appears that every language has a word for 'one' and 'two', but not every language has a word for the numbers higher than two. Many languages have several words that mean 'one'.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to one?
questionGroup.words: one, first, individual, single, only, the one, one apiece, one each

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to being by yourself?
questionGroup.words: alone, by yourself, sole

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to doing something by yourself?
questionGroup.words: alone, on your own, solo, solely

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to people doing something one by one?
questionGroup.words: one by one, singly, individually

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done one time?
questionGroup.words: once, one time, single time, one-off

item.name: Two
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to the number two.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to two?
questionGroup.words: two, second, two times, two-fold, double (v), twins, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke, in pairs, in twos, two by two, by twos, two at a time, two apiece, two each, both, either, neither

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to two people who do things together?
questionGroup.words: couple, pair, duo, twosome, duet

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to two things that are used together?
questionGroup.words: pair, twin

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to something used by two people?
questionGroup.words: for two, double, two-man

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to something with two parts?
questionGroup.words: double (adj), couplet, duplex

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to something used for two things?
questionGroup.words: dual, twofold

questionGroup.question: (7) What words indicate that something is two times the amount of something else?
questionGroup.words: twice, double, twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that something happens or is done two times?
questionGroup.words: twice, twice over, two-time

item.name: Ordinal numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to the ordinal numbers (first, second, third)--the numbers used to indicate the order of something in a series, such as "the first child".

questionGroup.question: (1) What are the ordinal numbers?
questionGroup.words: first, second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seven, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, hundredth, thousandth
questionGroup.sentences: My parents had five boys and I am the <second>.; This book is the <third> in the series.

item.name: Number of times
item.descr: Use this domain for numbers that refer to the number of times something happens or is done. These numbers may be adverbs as in English (twice) or in some languages they may be verbs (to do something two times).

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate the number of times something has happened? ("He fell down three times.")
questionGroup.words: once, one time, single time, twice, two times, three times, thrice, four times, many times
questionGroup.sentences: Mary washed the dress <three times>.; I have lent John money <many times>.; I have lent John money <twice>.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that has happened a particular number of times?
questionGroup.words: two-time, three-time

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to doing something a particular number of times (to do something once/twice/etc.)?
questionGroup.words: (none in English)

item.name: Multiples
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to multiples of something (single, double, triple).

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe something that is two or three times the amount of something else?
questionGroup.words: single (portion, scoop), double (adj), triple, quadruple, quintuple, two-fold, three-fold, four-fold
questionGroup.sentences: The oldest son inherited a <double> portion.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that something is two or three times the amount of something else?
questionGroup.words: twice as much (as), two times as much (as), two times what, double what
questionGroup.sentences: He gave you <three times what> he gave me.; He gave you <three times as much as> he gave me.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to something becoming two or three times as much?
questionGroup.words: double (vi), triple, quadruple
questionGroup.sentences: The size of our herd <doubled> in three years.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to making something become two or three times as much?
questionGroup.words: double (vt), triple, treble, quadruple
questionGroup.sentences: My boss <doubled> my salary.

item.name: Numbered group
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to a group of a particular number of things or people (solo, duo, trio; alone, in threes).

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a group of a particular number?
questionGroup.words: single, duo, duet, trio, quartet, quintet, sextet, twins, triplets, quadruplets, quintuplets, sextuplets, twosome, threesome, foursome, fortnight, decade, century, millennium, dozen, score, gross

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that only one person does something?
questionGroup.words: alone (adv), solo

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to a group of two?
questionGroup.words: pair, couple, couplet, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to a group of three?
questionGroup.words: trilogy, trinity, triple, triumvirate, triune

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that something is done in groups of a certain number?
questionGroup.words: singly, one by one, two by two, three by three, by ones, by twos, by threes, in pairs, in threes, one at a time, two at a time, three at a time

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that everyone is to get a certain number of something?
questionGroup.words: one apiece, two apiece, three apiece, one each, two each, three each

item.name: Fraction
item.descr: Use this domain for the numbers that refer to a fraction of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What general words refer to a fraction of something?
questionGroup.words: fraction, proportion, percentage, decimal, decimal point

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a particular fraction of something?
questionGroup.words: half, one half, third, one third, two thirds, quarter, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to dividing something into a fraction of the whole?
questionGroup.words: halve, quarter (v), bisect, trisect, (divide/cut/fold) in half, in two

item.name: Number series
item.descr: Use this domain for other series of numbers that are different from those in the previous domains.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to something made up of a certain number of parts?
questionGroup.words: duplex, tandem, tripartite

item.name: Count
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to counting--to say the numbers in order, or to use numbers to find an amount.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to saying the numbers in order?
questionGroup.words: count, countdown, say your numbers

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to counting the number of something?
questionGroup.words: count, count up, at the last count, keep count, keep track, keep a tally of, enumerate, enumeration

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to determining the amount of something without being exact?
questionGroup.words: estimate, assess, reckon

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to determining the quantity of something a second time?
questionGroup.words: recount, renumber

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to making a mistake when you count?
questionGroup.words: miscalculate, miscount, lose count

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the number or amount of something that is counted?
questionGroup.words: calculation, sum, estimate, estimation, count (n)

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to assigning a number to each thing in a series?
questionGroup.words: number, assign a number, count off

questionGroup.question: (8) What words describe an amount that cannot be counted?
questionGroup.words: innumerable, unnumbered, uncountable, uncounted, countless

item.name: Mathematics
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to mathematics and arithmetic--the study of numbers.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to mathematics?
questionGroup.words: mathematics, math, arithmetic, geometry, algebra, calculus, trigonometry, statistics

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to determining the amount of something?
questionGroup.words: calculate, work out, figure out, make, figure, compute, solve

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate the answer in an equation?
questionGroup.words: is, equals, get
questionGroup.sentences: Two plus two <is> four.; Two added to two <equals> four.; If you add two and two, you <get> four.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the answer to a mathematical problem?
questionGroup.words: answer, solution

questionGroup.question: (5) What words are used to talk about mathematics?
questionGroup.words: problem, equation, square root, squared, graph, axis

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to a person who studies mathematics?
questionGroup.words: mathematician, statistician

questionGroup.question: (7) What instruments are used to do mathematics?
questionGroup.words: calculator, computer, abacus, slide rule

item.name: Add numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to adding two numbers together.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to adding two numbers together?
questionGroup.words: add, addition

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to adding a series of numbers?
questionGroup.words: add up, tally (v), total (v)

questionGroup.question: (3) What words are used for addition equations?
questionGroup.words: plus, and, added to
questionGroup.sentences: Two <plus> two is four.; Two <and> two makes four.; Two <added to> two equals four.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate the answer in an equation?
questionGroup.words: makes

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the total?
questionGroup.words: total (n), total (adj), sum, tally (n), grand total, subtotal, gross, aggregate, amount

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that a particular number is the total?
questionGroup.words: altogether, in total, in all, all told

questionGroup.question: (7) What words indicate that the number of a group of things reaches a particular total?
questionGroup.words: come to, amount to, total (v), reach, add up to, make, bring the number to, bring the total to, number (v)

item.name: Subtract numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to subtracting one number from another.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to subtracting one number from another number?
questionGroup.words: subtract, take, take away, deduct, subtraction

questionGroup.question: (2) What words are used for subtraction equations?
questionGroup.words: minus, subtracted from, from, less
questionGroup.sentences: Four <minus> two equals two.; Two <subtracted from> four equals two.; Two <from> four is two.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate the answer?
questionGroup.words: leave, be left with

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the answer?
questionGroup.words: remainder, difference

item.name: Multiply numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to multiplying one number times another.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to multiplying one number times another?
questionGroup.words: multiply, multiplication, multiples of (a number)

questionGroup.question: (2) What words are used for multiplication equations?
questionGroup.words: multiplied by, times
questionGroup.sentences: Two <multiplied by> two equals four.; Two <times> two makes four.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate the answer?
questionGroup.words: makes

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the answer?
questionGroup.words: product

item.name: Divide numbers
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to dividing one number by another number.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words are used of dividing one number by another number?
questionGroup.words: divide, division

questionGroup.question: (2) What words are used for division equations?
questionGroup.words: divided by, into, go into
questionGroup.sentences: Four <divided by> two is two.; Two <into> four equals two.; Two <goes into> four two times.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate the answer?
questionGroup.words: times

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the answer?
questionGroup.words: quotient

item.name: Plural
item.descr: Use this domain for words and affixes that indicate that there is more than one of something. Some languages, such as Indo-European languages, indicate plural with an affix. Other languages, such as Austronesian languages, use a separate word. Some languages also have words or affixes that indicate that there are two of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that there is more than one of something?
questionGroup.words: -s

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there are two of something?
questionGroup.words: pair of

item.name: Many, much
item.descr: Use this domain for words indicating that there are many things or people, or that there is much of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that there is a large amount of something?
questionGroup.words: a lot of, lots of, a great deal of, a good deal of, a fair bit of, a fair amount of, much, loads of, tons of, masses of, scads of, piles of, heaps of, stacks of, a mountain of, extensive, widespread, big amount, lots and lots

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there are a large number of things or people?
questionGroup.words: a lot of, lots of, many, many of, a large number of, large numbers of, plenty of, loads of, tons of, masses of, scads of, a bunch of, dozens of, numerous, a host of, quite a few, a wide range of, a raft of, multi-, multiple, a multitude of, considerable, goodly number, plethora, profuse, oodles, scores of

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that there are a very large number of things or people?
questionGroup.words: hundreds of, thousands of, millions of, a great many, countless, innumerable, overwhelming, myriad

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that many things are happening?
questionGroup.words: flood of, wave of, deluge of, avalanche of, stream, torrent

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that many bad things are happening?
questionGroup.words: spate of, epidemic, rash of, wave, be a hotbed of

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that many people are doing something?
questionGroup.words: in large numbers, in droves, in force, in strength, thick and fast, be dying like flies, be dropping like flies

questionGroup.question: (7) What words describe something that many people are doing?
questionGroup.words: common, popular, widespread, widely

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that someone does something a lot?
questionGroup.words: a lot, a good deal, a great deal, quite a bit, plenty, heavy

questionGroup.question: (9) What words describe something that contains a lot of a particular substance?
questionGroup.words: high in, rich in

questionGroup.question: (10) What words describe someone who makes many things?
questionGroup.words: productive, prolific

questionGroup.question: (11) What words refer to using or giving a lot of something?
questionGroup.words: generous, liberal

questionGroup.question: (12) What words describe a large number or amount?
questionGroup.words: large, big, high, sizable, considerable, substantial, significant, generous, handsome, hefty

questionGroup.question: (13) What words describe a very large number or amount?
questionGroup.words: huge, enormous, vast, massive, colossal, goodly, immense, whopping

item.name: Few, little
item.descr: Use this domain for words related there being few or little of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that there is a small amount of something?
questionGroup.words: a little, a bit of, a small amount of, trace, trickle, dab, an element of, a touch of, a hint of, taste of, dearth, grain, hair, inappreciable, inconsequential, inconsiderable, infinitesimal, insignificant, iota, limited, minimum, minute, mite, moderate, modest, modicum, ounce, particle, poor, scant, scanty, scintilla, shred, slight, smidgen, some, speck, spoonful, suggestion, suspicion, tidbit, tinge, tiny, trifle, whit

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there is a very small amount of something?
questionGroup.words: not much, very little, to speak of, hardly any, scarcely any, almost no, minimal, negligible, precious little, next to nothing, a smattering of, a scrap of, tiny, minute

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that there are a small number of things or people?
questionGroup.words: few, a small number of, one or two, a handful of, sparse, not many, a couple of

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that there are a very small number of things or people?
questionGroup.words: very few

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to a small amount of food?
questionGroup.words: a little, a drop of, pinch, dash, mouthful, in moderation, meager

questionGroup.question: (6) What words describe something that contains a little of a particular substance?
questionGroup.words: low in

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to a small amount of money?
questionGroup.words: next to nothing, nominal, a drop in the ocean, paltry, miserly, a pittance, peanuts

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to a small number of people that are part of a larger group?
questionGroup.words: a minority of

questionGroup.question: (9) What words indicate that few people are doing something?
questionGroup.words: a trickle, in dribs and drabs, in ones and twos

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to using or giving a little of something?
questionGroup.words: dab (v), spoon out, frugal, parsimonious, scrimp, be sparing, stingy, stint

item.name: Group of things
item.descr: Use this domain for words that refer to a group of things.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a group of things?
questionGroup.words: group, collection, lot, cluster, clump, assortment, accumulation, aggregate, bits-and-pieces, nuts-and-bolts, odds-and-ends, stockpile, system, volley, wares

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a group of things that belong together?
questionGroup.words: set, batch, suit

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to a group of things that are tied or joined together?
questionGroup.words: bundle, bunch, sheaf, pack, package, packet, string of

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to a group of things that are put on top of each other?
questionGroup.words: pile, stack, heap

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to a group of things that are moved together?
questionGroup.words: cargo, contents, freight, goods, lading, load

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that something is a member of a group?
questionGroup.words: member, one of, part of, belong to, go with

item.name: More
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to there being more of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to more of something in addition to what is already there?
questionGroup.words: more, extra, another, added, additional, further, supplementary, spare
questionGroup.sentences: We need more food.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate an amount that is more than an amount already mentioned?
questionGroup.words: more than, over and above, as well as, plus, in addition to, on top of
questionGroup.sentences: We need five chickens in addition to the ten we already have.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words describe something that is more than another thing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: more, greater, higher, to a greater extent, to a greater degree
questionGroup.sentences: I own more land than you.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that the actual number is more than a particular number?
questionGroup.words: more, over, above, beyond, greater than, in excess of, upwards of, plus, at least
questionGroup.sentences: More than 100 people came to the wedding.

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to something being more than a particular number or amount?
questionGroup.words: be more than, be greater than, exceed, outnumber, be up on, pass, go past, surpass
questionGroup.sentences: My land is more than five acres.

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that there are many more of something?
questionGroup.words: many more, much more, far more, far beyond, way beyond, a lot more

item.name: Less
item.descr: Use this domain for words that indicate that the number or amount of something is less than the number or amount of another thing.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe something that is less than another thing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: less, fewer, not as much, not so much, not as many, not so many, lower, to a lesser degree, to a lesser extent, be in the minority, fewer and fewer, less and less, not more than, at the most
questionGroup.sentences: I own less land than you.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that something is less than a particular number or amount?
questionGroup.words: less than, under, below, lower, within, minus
questionGroup.sentences: My land is less than five acres.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that there is much less of something?
questionGroup.words: much less, far less, far fewer, way below

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something is less in some quality than another thing?
questionGroup.words: less, not as, not so

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that something happens less or is done less?
questionGroup.words: not as much, not so much

item.name: Increase
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to something increasing in number or amount--to be more than before.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to something increasing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: increase, go up, rise, grow, climb, gain, escalate, pick up, improve, widen, augment, expand

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that is increasing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: increasing, rising, growing, mounting, escalating, expanding, more and more, cumulative

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to increasing a lot?
questionGroup.words: multiply, double, treble, quadruple, proliferate, snowball

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to increasing very quickly?
questionGroup.words: shoot up, soar, rocket, go through the roof, spiral, take off, jump

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to increasing slowly?
questionGroup.words: accumulate, build up, pile up, collect, gather, mount up

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to causing something to increase?
questionGroup.words: increase (vt), raise, put up, push up, drive up, force up, boost, maximize

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to increasing something by adding to it?
questionGroup.words: add to, strengthen, swell, augment, supplement

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to increasing what a machine is doing?
questionGroup.words: turn up

questionGroup.question: (9) What words refer to an increase in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: increase (n), growth, rise, raise, build-up, upturn, hike, increment, proliferation, addition, supplement

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to a large increase?
questionGroup.words: leap, surge, explosion, boom, jump

questionGroup.question: (11) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something more than before?
questionGroup.words: increasingly, gain ground, get more and more, become more and more, grow in, gain in

questionGroup.question: (12) What words describe something that someone is doing or feeling more than before?
questionGroup.words: increased, heightened, greater, higher

item.name: Decrease
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to something decreasing in number or amount--to be less than before.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to something decreasing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: decrease, fall, go down, come down, slide, diminish, contract, shrink, lessen, reduce, reduction, depreciate, lose, narrow, slow down, abate, peter out, tail off, waste away

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that is decreasing in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: decreasing, declining, falling, lowering, shrinking, less and less, fewer and fewer

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to decreasing very quickly?
questionGroup.words: drop, plummet, plunge, nosedive, slump, collapse, go through the floor

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to decreasing slowly?
questionGroup.words: dwindle, decline, be on the decline, taper off, drop off, die down, ease off

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to a decrease in number or amount?
questionGroup.words: decrease (n), reduction, drop, fall, decline, downturn, loss, cut, slump, collapse

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to a quality becoming less?
questionGroup.words: lessen, subside, wane, ebb, recede

questionGroup.question: (7) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something less than before?
questionGroup.words: decreasingly, lose ground, become less and less, get less and less

questionGroup.question: (8) What words describe something that someone is doing or feeling less than before?
questionGroup.words: decreased, lowered, lower

questionGroup.question: (9) What words refer to causing something to decrease?
questionGroup.words: reduce, lower, decrease, cut, slash, roll back, knock down, halve, minimize, abbreviate, abridge, curtail, dilate, drain

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to reducing the amount of something you use or how much you do?
questionGroup.words: reduce, cut down on, scale down, scale back, cut back, trim, pare down, downsize, scrimp

questionGroup.question: (11) What words refer to reducing pain or a bad feeling?
questionGroup.words: reduce, lessen, relieve, ease, alleviate, deaden, dull, take the edge off, allay, mitigate

questionGroup.question: (12) What words refer to decreasing what a machine is doing?
questionGroup.words: reduce, lower, turn down

questionGroup.question: (13) What words refer to something slowly reducing the number or amount of something?
questionGroup.words: erode, eat into, deplete, whittle away

item.name: All
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to all.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to all of a group of things?
questionGroup.words: all, everything, the lot, every, each, without exception, altogether, total, a hundred percent, whatsoever, whichever
questionGroup.sentences: <Each> went his separate way.; <each> person

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to all of something?
questionGroup.words: all, whole, entire, the lot, every bit of, every inch of, every drop of, in its entirety, from start to finish, the whole of, totality

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to all of what you want?
questionGroup.words: whatever, anything, everything but the kitchen sink, you name it

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe something that affects or includes everything?
questionGroup.words: total, blanket, overall, global, all-embracing, universal, all-pervading, complete, comprehensive, exhaustive, full, general, indiscriminate, sweeping, thorough, thoroughgoing, unmitigated, unqualified, utter, widespread, worldwide

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to all people?
questionGroup.words: everyone, everybody, anybody, whoever, whomever, whomsoever, whosoever

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to all times?
questionGroup.words: always, every time, any time, everyday

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to all places?
questionGroup.words: everywhere

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to all ways?
questionGroup.words: every way, all-out

item.name: Some
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to some--a number or amount of things or people when the number is not stated; an indefinite number or amount.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate some of a group of things or people?
questionGroup.words: some, any, several, a number of

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate some of an amount of something?
questionGroup.words: some, any, a certain amount of, a measure of

item.name: None, nothing
item.descr: Use this domain for words that nothing, no one, never, and nowhere.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to no thing?
questionGroup.words: none, not any, no, nothing, not anything, be nil, bugger all

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to not any of a number of things?
questionGroup.words: none, not any, no, not one, not a, nothing

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to no person?
questionGroup.words: no one, nobody

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to no time?
questionGroup.words: never, no time

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to no place?
questionGroup.words: nowhere, no place

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the number zero?
questionGroup.words: zero, nil, naught, o

item.name: Both
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to both of two things.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to both of two things?
questionGroup.words: both, the two of, the pair of, each, mutual, share, either, neither
questionGroup.sentences: I couldn't decide which of the two I wanted more, so I bought them both.; The plan would be to our <mutual> benefit.; We have a <mutual> friend.; They <share> the same name.

item.name: Most, almost all
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to most--more than half and less than all of something.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to most of something?
questionGroup.words: most, almost all, nearly all, the majority, the bulk of, the better part of, the best part of, the lion's share, the biggest slice of the cake

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that is done by most people?
questionGroup.words: generally, broad

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that most of a group is of one kind.
questionGroup.words: mostly, mainly, largely, predominantly, predominate, be in the majority, a preponderance

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something more than anything else?
questionGroup.words: mostly, mainly, in most cases, most of the time

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to less than half of something?
questionGroup.words: minority

item.name: Most, least
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to the most--the largest number or amount; or the least--the smallest number or amount. Most/least may refer to the largest/smallest number possible or needed. If there are several groups being counted, most/least may refer to the largest/smallest group.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to the largest amount of something?
questionGroup.words: maximum, most

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to the smallest amount of something?
questionGroup.words: the least, minimum, the fewest, the lowest

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the largest group?
questionGroup.words: the most
questionGroup.sentences: Who has the <most> children?

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the smallest group?
questionGroup.words: the least

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to an amount being the largest it has ever been?
questionGroup.words: an all-time high, record high, high water mark

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to an amount being the smallest it has ever been?
questionGroup.words: an all-time low, record low, lowest ebb

item.name: Almost
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to a number or amount that is almost the same as another number.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that something is almost a particular number or amount?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, close to, close on, approaching, nearing, not quite, be pushing, pretty well
questionGroup.sentences: He is almost 100 years old.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that someone has almost reached a place?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, just about
questionGroup.sentences: We are <almost> there.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that something has almost reached a particular state?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, very nearly, just about, practically, virtually, all but, as good as, to all intents and purposes, nearing, approaching, near to, close to, verging on, bordering on, more or less, pretty much, not quite
questionGroup.sentences: The clothes are <almost> dry.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something is almost finished?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, just about, practically, as good as, more or less, not quite
questionGroup.sentences: We are <almost> finished.

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that someone almost does something?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, very nearly, come close to, be on the verge of, come within an inch of
questionGroup.sentences: I <almost> hit you.

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that something almost happens?
questionGroup.words: almost, be near to, be on the brink of, come within an inch of
questionGroup.sentences: He <almost> died.

questionGroup.question: (7) What words indicate that something is almost the best or worst example of some quality?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, practically, virtually, just about, verging on, bordering on
questionGroup.sentences: He is <almost> the worst student in the school.

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that something is so similar to something that it is almost the same thing?
questionGroup.words: almost, practically, virtually
questionGroup.sentences: That dog is <almost> human.

questionGroup.question: (9) What words indicate that something is almost some quality (such as some color or shape)?
questionGroup.words: almost, more or less, practically, virtually, not quite
questionGroup.sentences: The road is <almost> straight.

questionGroup.question: (10) What words indicate that something is true of or has happened to almost all of something?
questionGroup.words: almost, nearly, practically, virtually, pretty well, more or less, just about
questionGroup.sentences: <Almost> everyone is sick.

item.name: Only
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to only a particular number or amount of people or things--no more than one, or no more than a particular number or amount.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe the only person or thing?
questionGroup.words: only, sole, the one, lone, solitary, alone, one and only, single
questionGroup.sentences: I had four brothers, but I am the <only> one who is still alive.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there is only a particular number or amount of something?
questionGroup.words: only, just, no more than, all
questionGroup.sentences: We <only> have five chairs.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate something is true of only one thing or one group of things, and not true of others?
questionGroup.words: only, just, exclusively, nothing but, nothing else, be limited to, be restricted to, be confined to, be unique to, be peculiar to, exclusive
questionGroup.sentences: <Only> men can grow beards.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something is only what you say it is, and not something more?
questionGroup.words: only, just, purely, merely, mere, nothing but
questionGroup.sentences: He doesn't understand--he's <only> a child.; I don't want anything--I <only> want to help.

item.name: Exact
item.descr: Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is exact--not more and not less.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is exact?
questionGroup.words: exact, precise

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that a number or amount is exact?
questionGroup.words: exactly, precisely

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that something happens at an exact time?
questionGroup.words: exactly, precisely, on the dot, sharp
questionGroup.sentences: John begins at <exactly> 6 a.m.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something happens at an exact place?
questionGroup.words: right, bang, smack, plumb

questionGroup.question: (5) What words describe something that is exactly the same as another thing?
questionGroup.words: exact, accurate, faithful, strict, literal, word for word, just

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that something is done in exactly the right way?
questionGroup.words: exactly, strictly, religiously, to the letter

item.name: Approximate
item.descr: Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is approximate.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe a number or amount that is approximate?
questionGroup.words: approximate, rough
questionGroup.sentences: We need to know the <approximate> weight of his suitcase.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that is not exact?
questionGroup.words: inexact, inaccurate, sort of, kind of

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that a particular number or amount is approximate?
questionGroup.words: about, approximately, roughly, give or take, at a guess, somewhere in the region of, an estimated, some, something like, in round numbers, close to
questionGroup.sentences: It weighs <about> four kilos.; John walks <approximately> two miles a day.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly more?
questionGroup.words: or so, odd, or more, at least, and maybe more, barely, hardly, little more than, scarcely

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly less?
questionGroup.words: at most, as much as, short of

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to determining the approximate number of amount of something?
questionGroup.words: approximate (v), estimate (v), overestimate, underestimate

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to estimating a number to the nearest ten, hundred, thousand, etc?
questionGroup.words: rounded to the nearest ten/hundred/thousand, round up, round down

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to a number that is approximate?
questionGroup.words: estimate (n), approximation, ballpark figure, round figure

questionGroup.question: (9) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate time?
questionGroup.words: about, around, approximately, round about, or thereabouts, circa, some time

questionGroup.question: (10) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate place?
questionGroup.words: about, around, in the vicinity of, near, close to

questionGroup.question: (11) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
questionGroup.words: narrowly, rather

questionGroup.question: (12) What words indicate that something is done in approximately the right way?
questionGroup.words: roughly, more or less, somewhat

questionGroup.question: (13) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
questionGroup.words: loose, vague, hazy, impressionistic, broad

item.name: Average
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to an average number.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to an average number?
questionGroup.words: average (n), mean, medium, median

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe an average number?
questionGroup.words: average (adj), mean (adj), medium (adj), medial, on average

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to calculating the average?
questionGroup.words: average (v), average out

item.name: Whole, complete
item.descr: Use this domain for words describing a whole thing--all of something with no parts missing.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that something is whole?
questionGroup.words: complete, full, whole, in full, in its entirety, be all there, all of, entire, intact, undivided, united

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to making something complete?
questionGroup.words: complete, make up, assemble

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that something is not whole?
questionGroup.words: incomplete, partial, missing something

item.name: Part
item.descr: Many things have parts. Use this domain for words referring to a part of something, and for words that express the idea that something has parts, that something is a part of something, or that link the whole with a part.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a part of something?
questionGroup.words: part, bit, portion, section, segment, sample, cross-section, member

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to the parts that something is made from?
questionGroup.words: component, element, piece, ingredient, constituent

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the parts of a process?
questionGroup.words: stage, phase, round

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to the parts of an organization?
questionGroup.words: branch, department, division, section, sector, wing, end, subdivision

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the parts of a story?
questionGroup.words: episode, installment, chapter, scene, part, extract, excerpt, clip

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the parts of a situation?
questionGroup.words: aspect, side, dimension, facet, factor, feature, detail

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to being a part of something?
questionGroup.words: be part of, form a part of, inherent

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that something has parts?
questionGroup.words: have, of, -'s, consist of, be made of, be made up of, be composed of, comprise, be divided into, include
questionGroup.sentences: Many animals <have> four feet.; The story <is composed of> several episodes.; This page <is part of> that document.; the wheel <of> the car; the boy<'s> foot

item.name: Piece
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to a part of something that has been broken or cut off.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a piece of something?
questionGroup.words: piece, bit
questionGroup.sentences: a <piece> of bread

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to a piece that has flat sides?
questionGroup.words: block, cube, slab, bar

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to a piece that is irregular in shape?
questionGroup.words: chunk, hunk, lump, dollop

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to a thin piece?
questionGroup.words: sheet, slip, pane, slice

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to a very small piece?
questionGroup.words: grain, flake, speck, fleck, crumb, morsel, tidbit, dot, mote

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to a small piece that is left after something has been broken?
questionGroup.words: fragment, scrap, splinter, chip, shard

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to a part of something that has been made by dividing it in some way?
questionGroup.words: pinch (of salt), cut (of meat), slice (of bread), bite (of cake)

item.name: Enough
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to being or having enough--to have as much of something or as many of something as you need or want.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe something that you have enough of?
questionGroup.words: enough, sufficient, adequate, satisfactory, enough to go round

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there is enough of something for what you need?
questionGroup.words: be enough, do, suffice, cover, last, meet someone's needs, get by, afford to

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that someone is strong enough or old enough to do something?
questionGroup.words: enough, sufficiently
questionGroup.sentences: John <is> strong enough to walk now.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe a situation in which someone does enough or something happens enough?
questionGroup.words: do enough, sufficiently, adequacy, adequately, satisfactorily, sufficiency

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to having enough of something?
questionGroup.words: have enough, be OK for, be all right for, be well off for, have sufficient

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to having enough of something to do what you want?
questionGroup.words: have the time/money, can afford, can spare, run to
questionGroup.sentences: John <has> the money to buy a bicycle.

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to having more than enough, but not too much?
questionGroup.words: more than enough, plenty, ample

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to not having enough?
questionGroup.words: not enough, insufficient, too little, too few, scarce, inadequate, inadequacy, shortage, lack of, be in short supply, be short

questionGroup.question: (9) What words indicate that there is not enough of something for what you need?
questionGroup.words: not be enough, be running short, not last, won't last

questionGroup.question: (10) What words indicate that someone is not strong enough or old enough to do something?
questionGroup.words: not (strong) enough, not sufficiently

questionGroup.question: (11) What words describe a situation in which someone does not do enough or something does not happens enough?
questionGroup.words: not...enough, too little

questionGroup.question: (12) What words refer to not having enough of something?
questionGroup.words: not have enough, be short of, be short on, go short, be running short of, deficient, be starved of, be lacking in

questionGroup.question: (13) What words refer to not having enough of something to do what you want?
questionGroup.words: not have enough, can't afford, be strapped for cash

item.name: Extra
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to having extra--to have more than enough or more than what you need.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to having extra?
questionGroup.words: have extra

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that there is more than enough of something?
questionGroup.words: plenty of, more than enough, bags of, in large quantities, plentiful, ample, abundant, an abundance of, in abundance, copious, galore, to spare

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the amount that is extra?
questionGroup.words: extra (n), surplus, excess, leftover, overflow

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe something that is extra?
questionGroup.words: extra (adj), spare, superfluous

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to having too much?
questionGroup.words: too much, too many, excessive

item.name: Lack

item.name: Remain, remainder

item.name: Distance
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to the distance between two things.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to the distance between two things?
questionGroup.words: distance, how far, span, as the crow flies

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate the distance between two places?
questionGroup.words: from, away, off, apart, away from
questionGroup.sentences: Dallas is a thousand miles <from> Phoenix.; Our house is two miles <from> town.; Our house is two miles <away>.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the distance something can move?
questionGroup.words: range, reach (n), extent
questionGroup.sentences: The gun has a <range> of one mile.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something (like an area or road) continues for some distance?
questionGroup.words: extend, stretch, go on, continue, spread
questionGroup.sentences: The road <stretched> on for miles.

questionGroup.question: (5) What question words ask for the distance between two things?
questionGroup.sentences: <How far> is New York from Washington?; <What is the distance> from New York to Washington?

item.name: Far
item.descr: Use this domain for words indicating that something is far from something else.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that something is far from something else?
questionGroup.words: far, far away, far off, afar, far afield, far and wide, a far cry from, far apart, far removed, distant, be distant, a long distance, in the distance, some distance, a good distance, a ways, way off, a long way (off), a long ways away, a fair way, quite a ways, nowhere near, miles (away), yonder, wide of, clear off, all over, asunder, at arm's length, on the horizon, the ends of the earth, uttermost parts of the earth
questionGroup.sentences: It is far from here to there, about a day's journey.

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to a long distance?

item.name: Type, kind
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to something being a type of thing, or that something belongs to a class of things.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words indicate that something belongs to a class of things?
questionGroup.words: be, be a kind of, be a type of, be a member of, include
questionGroup.sentences: An ant <is> an insect.; An ant <is a kind of> insect.; Dogs, cats, and horses <are members of> the animal <class>.; Plants <include> trees, flowers, and weeds.; The animal <class> <includes> dogs, cats, and horses.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to the class to which something belongs?
questionGroup.words: type, kind, class, group, variety

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to a member of a class?
questionGroup.words: kind (of), type (of), member (of), example (of), sort (of), such

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to assigning something to a class?
questionGroup.words: classify (with, as), classification, class, assign to a class, categorize, grade, group, sort
questionGroup.sentences: Mushrooms are not <classified with> the plants.; I would not <classify> this fossil <as> a dinosaur.

questionGroup.words: the same, the very same, the self-same, one and the same, common
questionGroup.sentences: This is <the same> man that I saw yesterday.; This isn't <the same> man, it's another man.

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe two things that are the same?
questionGroup.words: same, identical, indistinguishable, can't tell the difference, can't tell them apart, be no different from, match, be a carbon copy, word for word, be synonymous with, be no better than, be nothing more than
questionGroup.sentences: This is <the same> as that.; The twins are <the same> in every way.

questionGroup.question: (3) What words indicate that two numbers or amounts are the same?
questionGroup.words: the same, equal, equivalent, even, level

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe someone or something that is the same as before?
questionGroup.words: be the same, unchanged, hasn't changed a bit, hasn't changed at all, unaffected

questionGroup.question: (5) What words describe someone or something that never changes?
questionGroup.words: the same, consistent, unchanging, constant

questionGroup.question: (6) What words describe something that is the same in all its parts?
questionGroup.words: uniform, homogeneous

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to making all the things in a group the same?
questionGroup.words: standardize, bring something into line

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that two things that people said are the same?
questionGroup.words: correspond, be consistent with, agree, tally, coincide, match up

questionGroup.question: (9) What words indicate that something in one group is the same in some way as something in another group?
questionGroup.words: corresponding, equivalent, counterpart, opposite number

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to thinking the same as someone else?
questionGroup.words: like-minded, be on the same wavelength, be in tune with, be in harmony

questionGroup.question: (11) What words indicate that a part of one thing is the same as part of something else?
questionGroup.words: overlap

questionGroup.question: (12) What words indicate that two things are the same in some way?
questionGroup.words: equally, of equal, equal in, just as, as...as, every bit as, even, evenly

questionGroup.question: (13) What words refer to saying that two things are the same in some way?
questionGroup.words: equate

item.name: Like, similar
item.descr: Use this domain for words describing two things or people that are similar, but not the same.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe two things that are similar?
questionGroup.words: like, similar, alike, much the same, comparable, parallel

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to something being like another thing?
questionGroup.words: resemble, bear a resemblance to, akin to, have an affinity with, the same sort of

questionGroup.question: (3) What words describe two things that are very similar?
questionGroup.words: be two of a kind, have a lot in common, tantamount

questionGroup.question: (4) What words describe two things that are a little similar?
questionGroup.words: kind of like, vaguely resemble

questionGroup.question: (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done in a similar way?
questionGroup.words: similarly, like, such as, as

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to something being like another thing in some way?
questionGroup.words: have something in common, share something, correspond

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to something looking like another thing?
questionGroup.words: look like, resemble, the image of

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to something looking very much like another thing?
questionGroup.words: be just like, look just like, be the image of, be the spitting image of, be the living image of, could pass for, could be mistaken for, be a dead ringer for, be the picture of

questionGroup.question: (9) What words refer to someone who looks like another person?
questionGroup.words: look-alike, double

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to being like your mother or father?
questionGroup.words: be like, take after, be a chip off the old block

questionGroup.question: (11) What words indicate that someone or something makes you think of another person or thing because they are similar?
questionGroup.words: remind someone of, be reminiscent of, echo

questionGroup.question: (12) What words refer to the quality of being similar?
questionGroup.words: similarity, likeness, resemblance

questionGroup.question: (13) What words refer to the way in which two things are similar?
questionGroup.words: similarity, parallel

item.name: Different
item.descr: Use this domain for words describing two things that are different--not the same.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe two things that are different?
questionGroup.words: differ, different, else, vary, dissimilar, unlike
questionGroup.sentences: This <is different from> that.; <a different> man

questionGroup.question: (2) What words indicate that two numbers or amounts are different?

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the way in which two things are different?

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to discovering the difference between two things?
questionGroup.words: tell the difference, see the difference, distinguish, differentiate

item.name: Other

questionGroup.words: other, another, different, else, other than
questionGroup.sentences: This isn't the same man, it's <another> man.; I'm not talking about John, I'm talking about the <other> man.; I'm talking about someone <else>.; It must have been someone <other than> you.

questionGroup.sentences: John built his house <out of> cement blocks.; This picture was done <with> oil paints.

item.name: Right, proper
item.descr: Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is proper for a particular time, place, purpose, or job. The words in this domain involve a comparison between two things, an item and a setting. An evaluation is made as to how good the item is in the setting. The words may be used only of certain types of items, certain types of settings, or certain types of usefulness.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe something that is proper?
questionGroup.words: right, proper, applicable, apposite, apropos, becoming, befitting, correspond, correspondent, corresponding, decent, due, expected, felicitous, germane, meet, opportune, pertinent, pleasing, principled, properly, right-minded, rightful, smart, suitable, suited, timely, well, well-timed

questionGroup.question: (2) What words describe something that is right for a particular job?
questionGroup.words: right, proper, accepted, approved, appropriate, correct

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to something being right for a particular job?
questionGroup.words: suit, lends itself to, be suited to, be cut out for, be made for, fit the bill, fit in, be right for, be the right person for, make a good/ideal

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to something someone does that is right for a particular situation?
questionGroup.words: right, proper, acceptable, appropriate, apt, correct, fitting, suitable, be the done thing, be the way it's done, in keeping with

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to doing something in the right way?
questionGroup.words: right, properly, correctly, by the book

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to the quality of being proper?
questionGroup.words: suitability, suitableness, fit (n)

questionGroup.question: (1) What words describe something that is unsuitable?
questionGroup.words: improper, ill-suited, ill-timed, inadmissible, inapt, incongruous, incorrect, indecent, indelicate, malapropos, presumptuous, unacceptable, unapt, unbecoming, unbefitting, undue, unfit, unfitting, unsuited to, untimely, untoward

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to something being unsuitable for a particular purpose or situation?
questionGroup.words: wrong, unsuitable, not suitable, unsuited to, not suited to, inappropriate, not appropriate, hardly the time/place/person

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to someone being unsuitable for a job?
questionGroup.words: unsuitable, not suitable, not be cut out for, wrong, ill-suited to, not suited to

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to something being unsuitable because it isn't good enough?
questionGroup.words: unfit, not fit

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to something being unsuitable for a particular place?
questionGroup.words: be out of place, be out of keeping, not be in keeping, incongruous

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to someone being unsuitable for a particular place?

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the quality of being compatible?

questionGroup.question: (6) What words describe things or people that are incompatible?

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to people being incompatible?

Or something in nature such as a sunset or flower may inspire awe and wonder.

questionGroup.question: (4) What words indicate that something happens during the whole day?
questionGroup.words: all day long, the whole day long, the whole day through

questionGroup.question: (5) What words are used for the period of time when the sun is shining?
questionGroup.words: day (as opposed to night), during the day, daytime, daylight, daylight hours

item.name: Night
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to night.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to night?
questionGroup.words: night, nighttime

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to this night?
questionGroup.words: tonight, this night

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the night before this one?
questionGroup.words: last night

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to two nights ago?
questionGroup.words: two nights ago, the night before last

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the night after this one?
questionGroup.words: tomorrow night

questionGroup.question: (6) What words indicate that something happens during the night?
questionGroup.words: at night, during the night, in the night, by night

questionGroup.question: (7) What words are used to indicate that something happens every night?
questionGroup.words: nightly, every night, each night

questionGroup.question: (8) What words indicate that something happens during the whole night?
questionGroup.words: all night long, the whole night long

item.name: Yesterday, today, tomorrow
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to days relative to each other.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to one day in relation to the days before and after it?
questionGroup.words: today, yesterday, the day before yesterday, three days ago, tomorrow, the day after tomorrow, three days from now, the day before, the day after

item.name: Time of the day
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to a time of the day.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a time of the day?
questionGroup.words: time, hour, watch

questionGroup.question: (2) What words refer to dawn?
questionGroup.words: dawn, sunrise, daybreak, aurora, cockcrow, dawning, sunup

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to the time between dawn and noon?
questionGroup.words: morning, midmorning, am, antemeridian, ante meridiem, forenoon, matins, morn, early morning

questionGroup.question: (4) What words refer to noon?
questionGroup.words: noon, midday, meridian, midpoint, noonday, noontide, noontime

questionGroup.question: (5) What words refer to the time between noon and sunset?
questionGroup.words: afternoon, mid afternoon, pm, postmeridian, post meridiem

questionGroup.question: (6) What words refer to sunset?
questionGroup.words: sunset, sundown, twilight, dusk, nightfall, it gets dark, gloaming

questionGroup.question: (7) What words refer to the time between sunset and when you go to sleep?
questionGroup.words: evening, early evening, late in the evening, tonight, eventide, vesper, late night

questionGroup.question: (8) What words refer to the time when you go to sleep?
questionGroup.words: bedtime, time to go to sleep

questionGroup.question: (9) What words refer to midnight?
questionGroup.words: midnight, the middle of the night, pumpkin hour

questionGroup.question: (10) What words refer to the time between midnight and dawn?
questionGroup.words: late at night, the early hours of the morning (2-4), the small hours, the wee hours of the morning, the first watch, the second watch

questionGroup.question: (11) What words refer to the time just before dawn?
questionGroup.words: just before dawn, hours before dawn, predawn hours, it gets light, foredawn

questionGroup.question: (12) What words refer to the time when you wake up?
questionGroup.words: time to get up

item.name: Week
item.descr: Use this domain for words related to a week.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a week?
questionGroup.words: week, this week, last week, next week, the weeks to come

questionGroup.question: (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every week?
questionGroup.words: weekly, every week, each week

item.name: Days of the week
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to the days of the week.

questionGroup.question: (1) What are the names of the days of the week?
questionGroup.words: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday

questionGroup.question: (2) What other terms are used for the days of the week?
questionGroup.words: first day of the week (Sunday), second day of the week (Monday), midweek (Wednesday), Sabbath (Saturday), the Lord's day (Sunday)

questionGroup.question: (3) What words are used to refer to all the days of the week together?
questionGroup.words: days of the week

item.name: Month
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to a month.

questionGroup.question: (1) What words refer to a month?
questionGroup.words: month, this month, last month, next month, the months to come

questionGroup.question: (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every month?
questionGroup.words: monthly, every month, each month

questionGroup.question: (3) What words refer to a time during the month?
questionGroup.words: full moon, half moon, new moon

item.name: Months of the year
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to the months of the year.

questionGroup.question: (1) What are the names of the months of the year?
questionGroup.words: January, February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November, December

item.name: Season
item.descr: Use this domain for words referring to seasons of the year that are related to the time of year, the weather, or times of cultivation.
